Solar-powered community microgrids: In every home in the city, a small solar panel system could be installed that would feed into a community microgrid. This would allow homes to be powered locally and independently, reducing their reliance on the grid and providing backup power during outages.
Solar-powered streetlights: Solar panels could be installed on streetlights to provide lighting and reduce the city's energy consumption.
Solar-powered parking lots: Solar panels could be installed on the roofs of parking lots to generate electricity and provide a sustainable source of power for charging stations.
Solar-powered public transportation: Solar panels could be installed on buses and trains to provide a sustainable source of power for public transportation.
Solar-powered waste management: Solar panels could be installed on waste management facilities to generate electricity and power the equipment used to process and dispose of waste.
